B72B868FAC3842E7B0636C7B072BFC9B.description:
With increasing
independence, use frequently occurring
regular plural nouns, verbs,
prepositions, and question
words, ask and answer
interrogatives
(wh- questions), and produce and expand
simple sentences
in shared language
activities.

27701D2832794D629038827E586B6F3D.description:
With support (context and
visual aids), recognize and use
frequently occurring regular
plural nouns, verbs,
and prepositions, use and respond to
question words, and produce and expand simple
sentences
in shared language
activities

D34A7FC507DF49B48F7BA4638EA851E3.description:
With support (including
context and visual aids), recognize and use
frequently occurring
regular plural nouns,
verbs, and prepositions, use and respond to
question words, and produce simple
sentences
in shared language
activities.

76270D3B604A4A97A755E64708724345.description:
With support (including context
and visual aids), recognize and use
frequently occurring nouns,
verbs, and
short phrases, respond to yes/no and whquestions, and produce a few simple
sentences
in shared language
activities.

483AA4AABCAD4BDA8D88ABFDBB8BF32E.description:
With support (including
context and visual aids), recognize and use a small
number of frequently
occurring nouns
and verbs, and understand and respond to
simple questions.

A8020E5E4F1F4A3DB34C9A8163C0ACDF.description:
By the end of each English Language proficiency level, an English Language Learner can make accurate use of
standard English to
communicate in
grade-appropriate speech
and writing.

72C54847B93A4179836BC280440DD3E4.description:
With support (including visual
aids), retell a short sequence of
events from experience
or a familiar story, with a
beginning, middle, and end
using frequently occurring
linking words.

48B616F0057F456CB9779BA521CBA6D5.description:
With support (including visual
aids, context) retell a simple sequence
of events from experience
or a familiar story with
increasingly independent
control of frequently
occurring
linking words.

A347BE277F4640E1BEF03D49FCDD3BE1.description:
With support (including
visual aids, context), retell several events
from experience or
a familiar story with
developing control
of some frequently
occurring linking words
(e.g., and, then).

60D6251F067A48BBBFFA13378C13FCEF.description:
By the end of each English Language proficiency level, an English Language Learner can create clear and coherent
grade-appropriate speech
and text.

71F954E6EF8447B1B17AC8395DA31747.description:
With prompting and support
(including context and
visual aids), answer and ask questions
about the meaning of words
and phrases
in simple oral presentations
and read- alouds about a
variety of topics, experiences,
or events.

A9443A1745A64DB1A81D4FB275A67819.description:
With prompting and support
(including context and
visual aids), answer and sometimes ask
questions about the meaning
of words and phrases
in simple oral presentations
and read- alouds about a
variety of topics, experiences,
or events.

230FAB5F006E4CCE8A3E97811DF495A3.description:
With prompting and support
(including context and
visual aids), answer questions to help
determine the meaning of
some words and phrases
in simple oral presentations
and read- alouds about
familiar topics, experiences,
 or events.

80F7448EEC3B4A419209C1ABF2BB7099.description:
With prompting and support
(including context and
visual aids), recognize the meaning of
some frequently occurring
words and phrases
in simple oral presentations
and read- alouds about familiar
topics, experiences,
or events.

65DEF10E62F64D6196F34079469DE972.description:
With prompting and support
(including context and
visual aids), recognize the meaning of
a few frequently occurring
words
in simple oral presentations
and read- alouds about
familiar topics, experiences,
or events.

63E230DA5D454F4891DCFD5EA2B1FE3A.description:
By the end of each English Language proficiency level, an English Language Learner can determine the meaning of
words and phrases in oral
presentations and literary and
informational text.

27769F045CA94F8DA338F0F7C507C1ED.description:
Show awareness of
differences between
informal (“playground
speech”) and language
appropriate to the
classroom, and use some words learned
through conversations,
reading, and being read to.

BD72E6AB71F44E7E821A04960CD9BBEC.description:
Show a developing
awareness of the
difference between
appropriate language
for the playground and
language for the classroom.

E624F88BFFEA462ABB8BADAB4D114871.description: By the end of each English Language proficiency level, an English Language Learner can adapt language choices to purpose, task, and audience when speaking and writing.

1FC4695BB18841438E1A55455715875D.description:
With prompting
and support, identify appropriate
reasons an author or
speaker gives to support
main points.

ACCD86C0E21E4AF096E8A9B09127B538.description:
With prompting
and support, identify a reason an author
or speaker gives to support
a point.

FD60EA261BD34563A1F3A3EBAAE43EA0.description:
By the end of each English Language proficiency level, an English Language Learner can analyze and critique the
arguments of others orally
and in writing.

3CBB84ED29CE4CAE98AFC4C5E705610B.description:
With prompting and
support from adults, recall information from
experience or use information
from provided sources to
answer a question showing
increasing control.

256949FC5BA84487BBB1AFD202507DD8.description:
With prompting and
support from adults, recall information from
experience or use information
from provided sources to
answer a question showing
increasing control.

8FE91DEC16474A9CBB52D2866F7EB067.description:
With prompting and
support from adults, recall information from
experience or use information
from provided sources to
answer a question showing
developing control.

B2107A3C64E44DF1BC03DCD5449D1FA6.description:
With prompting and
support from adults, recall information from
experience or use
information from a provided
source to answer a
question.

03493B3B187B4D3C8C8E97D090A26CAE.description:
With prompting and
support from adults, recall information from
experience or from a provided
source.

7FC28A9A99564395BEE67F31CDE74A6E.description:
By the end of each English Language proficiency level, an English Language Learner can conduct research and evaluate
and communicate findings
to answer questions or solve
problems.

820E2D425340489186D2809817A3CD0B.description:
Express an opinion or
preference about a
variety of topics or stories
showing increasing control.

452DA354C6CC4DA0897E881CD38F50AE.description:
Express an opinion or
preference about a
variety of topics or stories
showing increasing
control.

01C45476FDF4437CB0CABCC2DB2CD7C3.description:
Express an opinion or
preference about a familiar
topic or story showing
developing control.

F6BF2A89D0E14DC49522D138BD4E3DD5.description:
Express an opinion or
preference about a
familiar topic showing
emerging control.

9113DB3C98304BCEAA5160CF62AD2EFD.description:
Express a feeling or opinion
about a familiar topic
showing limited control.

0DB81369C65847C3BACD4D6D45D18505.description:
An English Language
Learner can construct grade-appropriate
oral and written claims
and support them with
reasoning and evidence.

8F941DA3F06F42C095BFBD1441EF4BE6.description:
Make simple oral
presentations and compose short written
texts
about a variety of topics,
experiences, or events.

65D660EE2166473797DAF6BCEA34707C.description:
Tell or dictate simple
messages about a variety
of topics, experiences, or
events.

2E27A795E1704691B283A693DCD60D4D.description:
Communicate information
or feelings about familiar
topics, experiences, or
events.

EF6F2DC0AC824ED1B97EE3957DA1F229.description:
Communicate simple
information or feelings
about familiar topics,
experiences, or events.

ABCBFD7459F0404F816F4507A38954C4.description:
Communicate simple
information or feelings
about familiar topics or
experiences.

3F03876B69924ADEA8394F63660BF12B.description:
By the end of each English Language proficiency level, an English Language Learner can speak and write about
grade-appropriate complex
literary and informational
texts and topics.

17756D598F9043649A8B9F3362196E86.description:
Participate in conversations
and discussions, ask and answer questions, and follow rules for discussion
about a variety of topics.

76EFF7BC4EAC45778598DF289316F94A.description:
Participate in
conversations and
discussions, ask and answer simple
questions, and follow an increasing
number of rules for
discussion
about a variety of topics.

DD52A2BC2D5C413EA39CC92C74DE7D4A.description:
Participate in short
conversations, follow some rules for
discussion, and respond to simple yes/
no and wh- questions
about familiar topics.

73783590907941E6B645AEF406FEEBD1.description:
Participate in short
conversations and respond to simple yes/no
and wh- questions
about familiar topics.

192B2E6CA61D4394A5D2CBF9CA6D8F7E.description:
Listen with limited
participation in short
conversations and respond to simple yes/no
and some wh- questions
about familiar topics.

820F85381CE84C6C96EFC2CE882015B1.description:
By the end of each English Language proficiency level, an English Language Learner can participate in grade-appropriate
oral and
written exchanges of
information, ideas, and
analyses, responding to
peer, audience, or reader
comments and questions.

5A89513B27D3415288E7AA61F6904084.description:
With prompting and support
(including context and visual
aids), use a wide range of
strategies to: identify main topics, answer questions about
key details, and retell familiar stories
from read-alouds, picture
books, and oral presentations.

7CE33BD73BE842DB9CCA525580EBFFDF.description:
With prompting and
support (including context
and visual aids), use a
developing set of strategies
to: identify main topics, and ask and answer
questions about key
details
from read-alouds and oral
presentations.

A6B1583B4B6C43C6BE4F7128355982B8.description:
With prompting and
support (including context
and visual aids), use
an increasing range of
strategies to: identify main topics, answer questions about
key details or parts of
stories, and retell events
from read-alouds, picture
books, and oral
presentations.

0AD98DF1B6CB4A0899E402B2FC63A537.description:
With prompting and support
(including context and visual
aids), use an emerging set of
strategies to: identify some key words
and phrases
from read-alouds and oral
presentations.

C8E3D77A3B4D440B9BEC1A94B76FF6F6.description:
With prompting and support
(including context and visual
aids), use a very limited set of
strategies to identify a few key words
from read-alouds and
oral presentations of
information or stories.

634EC72DC26A4F93AE4FBE3AC9311CD9.description:
By the end of each English Language proficiency level, an English Language
Learner can construct meaning from oral presentations and literary and informational text through grade-appropriate listening, reading, and viewing.
